meanings.definition: A condition in which there is a loss of vision in a part of the visual field.
meanings.sent1: The doctor diagnosed the patient with anopsia in his left eye.
meanings.sent2: The anopsia in her right eye made it difficult for her to see clearly.
meanings.sent3: Despite his anopsia, he still enjoyed watching colorful sunsets.
meanings.sent4: The anopsia in her vision was like a missing puzzle piece in her sight.
meanings.sent5: The anopsia created a dark shadow in his field of view.

meanings.definition: The absence of vision in a part of the visual field.
meanings.sent1: Anopsia can affect a person's ability to see objects clearly.
meanings.sent2: The anopsia in his peripheral vision was concerning to the optometrist.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick made it seem like anopsia had struck the audience.
meanings.sent4: Her anopsia was a silent barrier in her line of sight.
meanings.sent5: The sudden onset of anopsia left him feeling disoriented.
